page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: The first{railway}through{Hucknall was suggested in 1845, The Nottingham and Mansfield Line. The cost was to be 6d.because there was an excellent Coach Service.In 1848 the first Railway Station opened for traffic. A railway journey from {Hucknall}to {London}at this time took 7 1/2 hours. There were 3 railway lines running through Hucknall, but now only 1 is left which is used by the Colliery. Local opinion regrets the loss of these lines. The main A road through Hucknall leads to the M1 junctions North and South. It is a busy road and had 1,688 vehicles along it in 2 hours during our Traffic Count.The main Bus Service is from Nottingham through Hucknall to Mansfield.There is a local Depot and Bus repair garage. { }
